messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] IRISH POLICE SEIZE 7000 ORIENTAL SWORDS
messages.msgSnippet: Somehow I find this very disturbing and somewhat confusing.. I just sent, Via USPS, a rather expensive pattern welded sword to a client in Ireland and he had
messages.messageBody:
Somehow I find this very disturbing and somewhat confusing..

I just sent, Via USPS, a rather expensive pattern welded sword to a client
in Ireland and he had no problem at all..and he has had no problems with
earlier shipments as well in either clearing Irish Customs or anything else.
Why he would have no problems and why the Irish police would raid and
confiscate these I have no idea as I have not read any Irish law as far as
swords go as yet.

Maybe this is due to the fact that the swords I have been sending are
historical replicas and those confiscated were not?

JPH

.


In a message dated 11/4/2009 4:21:50 P.M. Pacific Standard Time,
warlord@... writes:




_http://news.http://news.http://newshttp://news.<W_
(http://news.ninemsn.com.au/article.aspx?id=927117)

I should have put NSR (Not Sword Related) because the 7000 swords all
appear
to be repros, but it is nonetheless grist for our mill as a dilution of
knowledge as to what constitutes genuine historical swords endangers
Japanese art swords.

Regards,
Barry Thomas
(Melbourne (Australia)
